review: A wonderful experience, Alan is very knowledgeable man. I came away with  valuable knowledge to practice at home with how to work around Marco photography.

Alan clearly has a great enthusiasm for photography that he loves to share. He easily adapts his teaching style to suit each person’s individual needs. (Now if he could just get a better line through to the weather gods…)
Learned a lot
Great learning experience, Alan has been good guide and help clarify what exactly needed
Excellent day, really enjoyed the support and input for Alan. Helped to blow off the dust
Great guidance and expertise - highly recommended

Recently I attended a photography workshop with Alan at Batsford Arboretum.  The focus of the session concentrated on composition, aiming to make you think about the photograph you have in mind.  Alan has a wealth of knowledge and has the knack of being able to explain topics in an easy to understand way pitching at the right level - he’s very happy to take questions and encourages engagement.  A very positive experience, I enjoyed my afternoon taking on board the hints and tips that Alan provided.  Thank you.
Great Workshop at Batsford. Really helped with understanding composition and a great landscape to work in. Thanks Alan!

Great experience in a lovely location at Batsford Arboretum photographing the amazing autumn colours. Alan knows his stuff and the arboretum well so was able to guide us to some great locations and offer tips on composition, light and observation.
Outstanding instructor wise a very easy going approach I can highly recommend

I had a 1h 1:1 online mentoring session with Alan to sort out how to deal with my images on a long holiday. He was brilliant, clear instructions and a 2 page accurate summary of our conversation followed the same day.
I really enjoyed Alan’s beginner photography course. I have been taking photos for a couple of years but learned a lot in three sessions. I’m more informed on how to create better images now.
Very informative and a great way to start as a beginner. Learnt alot and got good feedback on assignments. Definitely recommend. 👍
Excellent interactive workshops to get to grips with the basics.

I had a day with Alan in the Peak district. We went to two locations that gave  varied types of subject. It helped me with understanding some of the technical aspects to consider when taking photos and the importance of composition. I came away with a more critical view of my own work which I feel is a good thing.

Alan has a great teaching approach , allowing you to develop your own style and offers alternatives , and different techniques. This allows you to think more deeply about your photography and seek out the best positions at a location, rather than just parking you at the ideal spot.
Great Photography lessons with Alan! The lessons were inspiring and well-structured. I learned new techniques that made a real difference in my photography.
Fun, informative, and perfect for beginners.
An insightful session on Lightroom course. Will be implementing this into our teaching practice.

I recently attended the Landscape Photography Devon Workshop with Mr. Alan Ranger, and it was an outstanding experience from start to finish. The workshop was well-organized, with a detailed schedule and excellent information about each location — including the best times for sunrise, sunset, high tide, and low tide. Everything we needed to know was clearly explained and thoughtfully planned.  The choice of locations was perfect for training and practice. Each spot offered unique opportunities to experiment with composition, light, and timing. I must admit, I learned a lot of useful techniques, creative ideas, and ways to think differently about each shot — especially the importance of being patient and waiting for the right moment.  There were only three of us in total, which made the experience even more personal and interactive. I also learned a great deal from my fellow participants. The commuting distances between locations were short and comfortable, and Alan proved to be not only an excellent tutor but also an excellent driver!  Overall, this workshop was both educational and inspiring. I’m truly grateful for the experience and hope to join Alan again for more workshops in other locations.

Hartland Quay 25-28 September 2025. My first photography workshop, and was a great experience.  Hotel very comfortable, good breakfasts and restaurant for dinners.  The locations chosen for shooting provided opportunities for landscape, seascape and intimate landscapes.  Alan gave analysis of images taken, advised changes to improve images and reviews of the results from each location, and kept us moving along.
Very enjoyable weekend landscape photography workshop with Alan in the Lake District.  Despite some challenging weather conditions I learnt an enormous amount and had a lot of fun.

A few days prior to the evening workshop Alan sent through a 2 page worksheet packing with useful information, which I found helpful. Alan also set the bracketing on my camera so I could compensate for the high contrast lighting.

I joined Alan for his Beginners Course. I’ve done similar courses before but a mix of Alan’s down-to-earth, simplified and easy to follow delivery meant I learnt more about the capabilities of my camera than at any previous courses.  I highly recommend Alan for his camera courses.

Alan provided Very Good overall experience i picked up on a lot of information on how the camera works and why we take pictures. the amount of information i have gained in the last 3 weeks alone has been surprising but very helpful i would highly recommend anyone looking to improve their photography and actually figure out why they want to take pictures spend some time with Alan
Sessions on Beginner’s course from Alan is very impressive in understanding on technical aspects on how camera works. Enjoyed the sessions and hopefully improve my camera skills.
Great course, lots of information and resources. Small group therefore not overlooked. Highly recommend.

Joined for the 3 week beginner course. Alan is super knowledgeable, I find the resources given most valuable as it allows me to revisit and expand my learning beyond what we covered in class. Could have done with the longer course I feel. Thank you

Alan is knowledgeable and a very good teacher. I attended the beginner’s course which comprised of the basics of photography and provided a detailed insight about the camera modes and settings which would definitely help me to get off the ‘Auto’ mode and click better pictures. I will definitely look forward to join the workshops and highly recommend Alan’s photography courses. Thanks Alan!
Mr Ranger is a wonderful photographer and is not shy to share his vast knowledge of this subject. His articles are easy to read and even easier to follow.
A great Workshop - I now have the confidence to move from using Auto to Manual with clear straightforward guidance from Alan, plus a new way of looking at composition
A fantastic free resource to learn about photography!!! Very good explanations off all the necessary concepts to get familiar with photography.
Alan's lessons are clear, concise and maybe the best on helping with excellent tips to take better photos and attract more birds .

I've been on several in-person workshops with Alan and have enjoyed all of them. He very generously provides his online Academy too: a wealth of advice on a range of topics, all invaluable for those of us who want to improve our photography skills and feel confident in a range of situations. It's much appreciated.
Great helpful material, great presentation and ideas

I can’t recommend this course enough. It really does cover everything in a very comprehensive and easily digestible way. I’ve played around with photography for a lot of my life but this course gave me the opportunity to learn about the theory and also practical elements of the discipline. I’d definitely recommend purchasing the .pdf download. It’s much easier to navigate than the online course and I felt it was a good way to donate for this great resource.  Thank you Alan!!
Would highly recommend if you're thinking about taking up photography as either a hobby or profession.

Alan was very welcoming. He sent the group landscape tips before we arrived for the workshop. On the day he gave us a print out, to reiterate the essential points, and he was very instructive, supportive and spent dedicated time with each client.

Technically competent and shared this and his experience freely. Offered professional advice and guidance with a light touch to help me, a complete novice, feel sufficiently at ease to move off Auto. I can now to start making progress and will be back for more, because it was money well spent
Alan is very good at what he does. John Simpson

The service and expertise is outstanding. No hesitation in recommending his services. We worked together on my photography panel for a distinction qualification with the RPS. In all areas (art craft and science) he is a true expert. In addition his character is friendly and helpful. His knowledge is extensive and constantly growing. He supports all levels of photographers.  In addition to his support, I worked with him in the field planning and photographing a number of sites, on the coast, over 3 days. Once again a superb service. Peter
I contacted Alan as I needed a quick turn around on a sensor clean before holiday. Alan sorted it out within a short time frame for a sensible price. Highly recommended.
Course was excellent. An eye opener for me. Things I may have read or heard before finally put into place. Great tutor (thank you for your patience Alan 😀)
Alan' learning session is much clear and detailed

I had an incredible experience training with Alan. His passion for photography is truly infectious, and his ability to break down complex techniques into easy-to-understand lessons made learning both fun and effective. Whether you're a complete beginner or looking to refine your skills, he tailors each session to your level and goals.  What stood out most was his hands-on approach—plenty of practical exercises, real-time feedback, and creative challenges that helped me grow in confidence behind the camera. He also has a great eye for detail and composition, and his tips on lighting and editing were game-changers for me.  Highly recommend to anyone serious about improving their photography. Professional, patient, and inspiring—this trainer is the real deal!

I had a half day session with Alan back in May for bluebell photography. Alan is very knowledgeable about the area and offer many tips for taking good pictures of the bluebells and wood in general. Would highly recommend Alan to anyone with all level of skills.

I had a great session. Found out more about my cameras and moving away from the "auto" setting. Seemed geared towards what was useful to me- with where I am with photography, not a "standard" pitch. Very much appreciated.

A great day spent learning about woodland photography, in fact as a beginner, I learnt a lot more about basic photography and how to use my camera.    Highly recommend spending time with Alan to get some great tips.

I did the Bluebells session which was excellent. Alan is very knowledgabel and approachable when discussing different topics, he has a wealth of knowledge, you just need to engage and ask questions. The session was an early start and very enjoyable, just a shame the bluebell area was not as perfect as it could have been, but not Alans fault. A very good experience all round and I am keen to do other sessions.
Alan is a good teacher. Great to learn new tips from Alan

I would recommend Alan to everyone! I've done the Beginner's Photography course, the Lightroom course and two workshops and thanks to these and Alan's coaching and honest feedback, my photography improved significantly. Thanks Alan!
Excellent, fun and informative day workshop.  Alan has great experience and is keen to share it to help and encourage our own photographic journeys.

Thoroughly enjoyed the workshop in the Peak District. Alan’s knowledge is excellent. The group were great to be with and we all had so many questions to ask Alan which he was more than happy to spend time with each and everyone of us to answer
Great photography workshop with Alan. He was informative and gave 1 to 1 attention to all on the course. Learnt more with him that I did on my own in years!

The Padley Gorge photo workshop was an excellent day. Alan guided us through various topics on photography and equipment, questions were answered with knowledge and experience, would highly recommend.
Alan is an amazing photographer! The photos are excellent and were sent on the same day (digital version). It all went really smooth. Definitely calling him again when in need for a photoshoot
It was a great experience with Alan in the bluebell field. Good tips from Alan for great shots. Highly recommended.

I joined Alan for a long exposure photography lesson at Kenilworth Castle on a beautiful May evening. While the sunny weather wasn’t ideal for long exposure shots, the session was still fantastic. Over the course of two hours, our small group (typically allows 6 people per event) received insightful guidance from Alan, who proved to be an excellent tutor. His deep knowledge and approachable teaching style made the lesson valuable for both beginners and advanced photographers alike. He helped us set up our cameras and provided clear explanations of the fundamental principles, ensuring everyone got the most out of the experience.
Alan is an excellent and highly knowledgeable photography tutor. I’ve learned a great deal from our online sessions, and I’m looking forward to attending some of his workshops in the near future.

Recently two of us  had a  morning’s practical tuition with Alan at an outside location with the aim of improving our landscape photography. I appreciated that Alan pitched the level exactly as we had requested with challenges to make  the best possible image from the terrain in front of us, and suggestions on how to better our results. He answered our many questions with specific and considered replies.
Great experience, I came away very satisfied that Alan had achieved his brief and I am more confident taking good landscape photographs.

Thoroughly enjoyed our (early) morning shoot, photographing Bluebells. Alan spent time with each of us and was all too keen to answer questions at all levels, from beginner to expert.  The joining instructions were next level, giving tips and tricks to try and implement during the shoot, and equipment to aspire to. Cheers for a great session.
Great workshop in a really nice location. Alan was very friendly and professional and had the right balance of helping and letting us challenge ourselves. Highly recommended :)

An excellent workshop with Alan, the weather may not have read the script, but that didn't stop me trying different compositions and techniques to capture the Bluebells. Alan has an excellent teaching style and very knowledgeable which he is keen to share.
Went on a woodland walk session which was enjoyable and informative.

I really enjoyed the Basic Photography course. Alan showed me how to properly use my camera and I'm looking forward to booking a 1-1 session so that he can critique my shots. He also makes a great cup of tea!!!

Alan has a passion for photography and his explanation of the subject was easy to follow as a less experienced person. Can't wait for next session with him to take my level of understanding up a level.
Alan's beginner photography course was excellent - exactly what I needed as a total newbie. Already booked another workshop with Alan and can't wait
Coventry Cathedral at night, 2 hours of photography with Alan and like minded people. Good subjects to photgraph and new skills learnt

Alan is such a friendly host, full of knowledge and a strong history of photography. His people skills and approach to tutoring is very positive. If you’re looking for a tutor, feedback on your current skills or anything in the photography world, I could not recommend Alan Ranger photography enough! Thank you Alan, see you again soon for a day out!

Excellent first session with Alan, I found him to be extremely knowledgeable and at the same time so generous with that knowledge. I learned a lot in the short session we had and I am looking forward to further workshops with him.

I had a 3rd hr of light room classic with Alan.  I consolidated my learning of LrC, and learning more on snapshots and how to publish on email and for competition submission, which are very useful.  Thank you.

Fantastic experience. Great tuition from a knowledgeable and friendly teacher. I came away with lots to think about. Unfortunately the light was not ideal but I think I learned a lot in one afternoon. Thanks Alan for your help and support.
Informative demonstration regarding bracketing and stacking. I also received very useful observations and advice upon many of my photos.

I received a gift card for a big birthday and I recently completed the Beginners course over an very extended period. This was only possible due to Alan's flexibility and patience. With the remaining credit I am now having some one to one tuition and guidance on a project I have in mind. The first meeting on the project went extremely well and Alan provided some highly practical advice and valuable insights into how to approach the assignment. I look forward to continuing our collaboration into the future.

I am an absolute beginner and was concerned that I would be overwhelmed. Alan was patient and helped me get to grip with the basics. He shared his knowledge and experience with the group. A thoroughly enjoyable afternoon in the beautiful Peak District.

I recently completed Alan’s 5 week beginners course which I throughly enjoyed and found invaluable. Alan provides clear explanations and practical tips, which helped me understand composition and camera use in a whole new way. It was great to practice different techniques and see our group’s confidence grow each week. There was a healthy dose of humour too :)  I highly recommend this course to anyone looking to improve their photography skills.
Attended the beginners photography course. The course exceeded expectations. Lots of different learning methods, very engaging and  an amazing about of learning

I have thoroughly enjoyed the Lake District photography workshop with a lovely small group.  We were blessed with excellent weather those few days.  Alan drove us to areas of Lake District that I have never been. I have learnt simple basic stuff (setting up of tripods) to using of ND filters (borrowed from Alan) to Lightroom editing whenever opportunities arose. Alan is a good teacher with very clear mindset of how to take a good photograph.  He however, did leave us to try and compose our own photos ... I have enjoyed and learnt much from the feedback session. Thank you Alan.

Lake District 3 day workshop in September.  This was my first residential workshop and I couldn't think of anyone better to do it with than Alan Ranger Photography.  His great knowledge of the area combined with his experience has made it really enjoyable whilst being able to pick up new techniques. Thank you Alan!  I would definitely consider and recommend Alan Ranger Photography for future workshops.

I participated in a woodland photography workshop this weekend. Alan offered great advice and patience, taking time to explain everything in layman’s terms. After an interesting slideshow we entered the woodland to the rear of his property. Alan suggested suitable opportunities to set up our tripods and endeavour to capture the perfect shot. With his considerable knowledge and professional approach, I would strongly recommend one of these workshops, particularly if you want to take control of your camera rather than relying on the auto setting!

Only one paid for session so far, but Alan was thoughtful, helpful and professional.  He listened carefully to what I needed and made sure I got it,  The free 20 min session beforehand ensured I am using his skills appropriately - it was very helpful.  UPDATE: since then I got in a muddle with files in Lightroom. Alan sorted it out online in one session and ensured I knew what to do to stop it happening again!

Alan is an intuitive, knowledgeable and thoughtful tutor. I have just completed 4 sessions as a beginner and can already see improvements in my photography skills.  I thoroughly enjoyed each session. They were all paced well and planned according to my levels and needs. There has been plenty of opportunities to ask questions and feedback was given at the start of each lesson on the previous weeks homework assignments. It has given me a new passion in photography and I look forward to continuing my journey. I would thoroughly recommend to anyone interested in developing their photography interest!

I chose Alan Ranger for photography processing instruction because he produces images of exceptional quality.  I was pleasantly surprised to discover that Alan is an outstanding teacher.  Alan explains how I could improve my images, then demonstrates several methods of enhancement.  I can recommend Alan's course to any photographer who wishes to optimise their image processing workflow.
Excellent service and would recommend highly. Helped my son out at the last minute and now his camera is dust free. One happy lad. Thanks Alan.

I finally got my longstanding issues resolved.  I should have consulted Alan a long time ago considering all the time I spent trying to fix things myself.  I had thousands of missing photographs in the Lightroom Classic catalog.  This is fixed now.  Also enjoyed working with Alan.  We got on fine.  Excellent experience entirely.  Would recommend Alan to a friend and consult with him again.

Update July 2024 - another very successful meeting with Alan. Helped me focus on where I am going with a project and provided quality food for thought on both the technical and composition elements of my photography. Enjoyed as always  Great webinar on editing, really useful advice to achieve your objective for an image. Small group and interactive, with Alan showing you step by step, the various Editing options.  Really enjoyed it

I really enjoyed learning as a beginner on the beginner photography course. Great communication, understanding and very helpful advice. Also had couple 121 sessions that went very well, Definitely worth your time if you have questions to be asked etc.

I really enjoyed the recent Abstract and Macro Photography course held by Alan Ranger. I received emails prior to the event with a list of equipment and directions to the course.  It was a small group, a relaxed atmosphere. Alan gave a small teaching session prior to starting the workshop. He explained anything you needed to learn and helped you understand depending on your knowledge/experience of photography.  There were four of us on the workshop. Alan gave us all one to one tuition. He displayed our images on a large screen and talked us through composition etc. He gave praise and constructive criticism, all on a one to one basis. I learned alot that day. I liked the way he offers tuition no matter what level you are.  He showed us some of his photography which was interesting. He really is a master in the field.  I highly recommend a photography course with him. I'd like to do more courses in the future.  Many thanks Alan for an enjoyable and most beautiful workshop in your stunning garden of mature plants and flowers. You really have a creative mind and I'm so glad you can teach your valuable photography skills to benefit others.

Great macro photography course with Alan for my first macro photographs, now posted on instragram. Good, helpful, understandable introduction then great location to practice, with Alan coming round regularly to see how getting on, look at images just taken, critique and suggest followed with quick review and comments on screen from memory card. Very helpful and productive day. Thank you Alan

I have done two workshops with Alan and both have been excellent. His teaching style is very much geared to the individual participants and the workshop numbers are limited so that everyone gets the amount of time / help that they need. His knowledge, both technical and of the locations used, is second to none. If anyone is considering doing a photography workshop I would have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending Alan.

Recently attended a workshop in private bluebell woods with Alan. This gave us extensive photo opportunities in an area usually closed to the public. Alan talked us through a variety of technical and compositional suggestions before letting us loose (with due regard to the environment). Alan was on hand to give constructive critical advice as needed.
Alan was very helpful and took time to explain. Meeting points and location for photography were excellent. Good weather was ice on the cake.

I had the the professional lesson about the manual settings on my camera with Alan. Alan is very professional and supportive. The material was very interesting and the discussions were truly inspiring. He has an impressive knowledge about the photography. I particularly enjoyed all the instructions, which made the content easily understandable. Alan showed me and taught me so many new things during my lesson. I also took a part in his few workshops which I really enjoyed. Especially workshop in the forest full of bluebells. Unforgettable experience. I can highly recommend Alan to everyone who would like to start the adventure with photography or improve the photography skills.

Alan provided a most enlightening day course on the theory and practice of woodland photography and the maximisation of the photos captured during a morning in the woods. He delivered all parts of the day with clarity and good humour to make it a most enjoyable and rewarding experience.

Alan is a supportive trainer willing to share advice and guidance as you require.  He doesn't over complicate issues and ensure you get the best from the event even when the weather decides to be unhelpful
A good session and well organised.
Well organised photo shoot. Communication was first class with written advice on equipment and camera settings. I would highly recommend this event.
Took part in Alan's recent Bluebell workshop. Weather and location were very good and Alan was helpful as always. Thanks again.

I attended the Lake District residential workshop recently. I was virtually a beginner but learnt so much from Alan. The organisation, locations and teaching style were excellent. Alan took good care of the group and ensured we got the most from the workshop this included adapting to our individual needs. Will definitely book again. Thank you.
The workshop I attended was very enjoyable, in a beautiful location, extremely well organised and with good company - thank you very much Alan for putting up with me!

I recently attended a 3 day workshop with Alan in the Lake District, and in that time it felt like I learned more about photography than at any other point in my life! It was an extremely well-organised trip and I found the time spent in a 1-2-1 environment with Alan was invaluable. He gave me clear and specific tuition, with guidance and advice tailored just for me. He was always willing to answer my questions and explain his approach to shooting images. Having spent the day in the field in a small group, the image review and feedback sessions later on were really useful and informative. I would definitely recommend Alan to anyone who is keen to improve their photography skills.
As always great experience with a great teacher. Alan is very patient and really helps you learn. Learned a great deal on this course both in camera and post processing

It was a great weekend with Alan - a small group so we had plenty of space but still social. Alan was able to inspire me to extend my photography both in the type of shorts (minimalism), the angles that I choose and the technical details. Thanks!

Working towards a distinction I found mentoring with Alan extremely helpful, he is very knowledgeable about all aspects of photography and processing.  He worked with me at a pace which was just right for me.  I thoroughly recommend mentoring with Alan.

I recently attended a 3 day course with Alan in Southwold  I was keen to learn more about long exposure and the course fulfilled this  There was plenty of time for other genre .  I thoroughly recommend these short courses.  The accommodation was excellent. Pam

I have had a few 1-2-1 sessions with Alan and I have found him to be an excellent teacher. Nothing is too much trouble, he is extremely patient and made sure I understood the concepts before moving on. I can highly recommend tuition with Alan and in reality 5 stars is insufficient - I'd give him 10!!

I thoroughly enjoyed both the beginners photography course and the lightroom course. I am a complete beginner but feel like I have learned so much. Alan is really good at giving examples and explaining things in a way you can understand. The classes are small, which makes them personal and we had lots of laughs throughout the course. Already signed up the monthly mentoring, which I’m hoping with continue to improve my knowledge and skills. Look forward to the workshops in the future. Thanks Alan.

I have attended a few good workshop with Alan and done some face to face lessons and summarizing, if you are looking for passionate, knowledgeable photographer who will guide you through this sometime complicated but also fascinating world, it is Alan. He is not a photographer but and artist and soulful person, who will inspire you with his stories as a person and teach you a lot with his experience. Workshops gave me very valuable time in beautiful places and interesting people, which worth is every penny as a life experience.

Alan's workshop was my first such course and combined a perfect combination of theory and practical guidance on composition and camera use. Regardless of your level of experience, Alan's workshops provide a friendly and constructive environment in which to enhance your skills. I look forward to the next one.

I attended a workshop for Autumn photography at Batsford arboretum with Alan. Alan immediately made me relaxed and made the whole experience fantastic. I gained lots of knowledge on technique, composition and correct use of my equipment thanks to the time given to explain things. I would definitely go on another workshop.

The landscape photography workshop in Snowdonia proved to be an enlightening experience, offering a comprehensive understanding of capturing nature's beauty. Led by Alan, the workshop adeptly combined theoretical insights with practical fieldwork, enhancing participants' technical skills and creative vision. The breathtaking Snowdonia vistas provided an ideal backdrop for mastering composition, lighting and exposure techniques, fostering a deeper appreciation for the art of landscape photography. The hands-on guidance and personalised feedback was commendable, enabling me to elevate my photography skills. Overall, the workshop's rich content, picturesque location and skilled mentor rendered it an indispensable opportunity for aspiring and seasoned photographers alike. I also enjoyed the relaxed social aspects of the workshop with first class accommodation provided.

My workshop experience with Alan was educational and enjoyable.  I particularly appreciated the unhurried pace, the encouragement to soak up our surroundings and to really think about composition found in nature's framing. I would definitely recommend regardless of your level of experience.
I like Alan's style of teaching much more engaging than some of the other workshop leaders I have experienced. Achieved some reasonable images from the day - thank you
Beautiful print received of a stunning photograph which I’ll frame for a present.

I have done many of Alan's workshops over the years, the most recent being his Woodland Masterclass. The day was divided into theory, practical and post processing sections with plenty of time allowed for each category. Alan gave every member of the small group plenty of time and attention, with help when necessary. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would recommend Alan's relaxed style of teaching to anyone who is considering using a photography tutor. Many thanks for a great day.

I have attended 2 photography courses (beginners & Lightroom) and 2 workshops (garden & woodland) with Alan so far and I really enjoyed all of them! He's a great teacher, who does not just simply shares his vast knowledge of photography, but also inspires you to want to learn all the (sometimes quite dry) technical details, so you can create amazing images that you can be proud of. I'm very happy for finding Alan right at the beginning of my photography journey and looking forward to attending more of his workshops in the future.

Alan was very thorough and patient with our group. The learning schedule was set-up with just the right balance of theory and practical. We left feeling that we had learned a lot, and can now put this into practice out in the field (or should I say wood/forest).

Had a fantastic weekend in the lake district with Alan Ranger on one of his residential courses with our fellow photography enthusiasts. Alan didn't just elevate our photography to another level, his skills, intimate local knowledge and organisational abilities were second to none. Alan was always receptive and willing to go the extra mile to make the experience perfect at the same time as providing honest, professional feedback and support. We will definitely be booking more workshops and weekend away with him soon. - Thank you Alan.

I recently attended a photographic workshop hosted by Alan, and I can't express how invaluable the experience was. Initially, I felt overwhelmed with the intricate settings of my camera, but Alan demystified them in a way that was both comprehensible and reassuring. Beyond the technicalities, he instilled in me the ability to 'see' a photograph – to truly understand the essence of a scene and capture it effectively. He also provided hands-on guidance with my tripod, ensuring I maximized its potential for stable, crisp shots.  For anyone keen on elevating their photography skills, whether you're a beginner or someone looking to refine your craft, I would highly recommend Alan's courses. His expertise, coupled with his patient and insightful teaching style, truly sets him apart.  I hope this helps, and I'm glad I had such a positive experience! Remember to continue practicing and experimenting with your camera; the world of photography is vast and constantly evolving!

S[ent the day on the Secrets of Woodland Photography.  Alan helped to demystify woodland photography, especially trying to find  a way through the complexity of the clutered environment, or embracing it.  The opportunity to put the discussion into practice and then have careful consideration of the images is invalueable.  The day went very quickly.

I’ve just completed a workshop in the Lake District hosted by Alan which I found fantastic. Alan is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about landscapes and the environment and works hard to ensure you get the very best from your photography  I have learnt so much from Alan and look forward to more of his workshops. I would thoroughly recommend to anyone who wants to learn and develop their photography skills

Great first introduction to the technical side of the camera and the back ground to photograph. Booked 4 hours, but too much to take in for a novice. Alan was very helpful as split this into 2 x 2 hour sessions.  I need to practice more with the camera and settings, to get the best out of the second session.  Very helpful and thanks for informative session

I have had the pleasure of attending several courses and workshops run by Alan and certainly plan to do more.  He is a true professional who shares his knowledge & experience with an overriding intention to improve your photography and increase the enjoyment on every occasion. Very straight talking to ensure you get the best from your photography and move from snaps to creativity. Alan goes the extra mile to help and support …. Even when his patience is tested !!

I am very happy with the one to one zoom classes I have been having with Alan, I wish I could attend a workshop in person. I now understand far more to enable me to use my camera and not be scared of all the settings! I am looking forward to learning the creative side now that I feel more confident with my camera. Alan has been very patient with my limited knowledge!
Amazing mentor, fantastic photographer. Will definitely book more courses in the future. Would give ten stars if I could.
A really good time with Alan 4 others on our half day shoot in the bluebells. A simply stunning location with,1000s of bluebells set in beautiful woodlands.
Alan undertook some house shoots for me. He was excellent in his communication before, during and after the shoot. End product was as described. Would love to use again

I love Alan's workshops.  I've been to 2 3day workshops. Alan is helpful when you need it but let's you get on with it at other times. I have learnt a lot from his sessions and enjoyed them. His feedback is valuable. He's well organised and thorough. His work before the workshops makes for a really good experience.  He chooses nice places to stay and the social aspect is good too. I'd recommend the workshops although the Gower in June is going to be a challenge because of the time of year. Although it's nicer to stand outdoors in the summer, workshops in autumn and winter would be my preference. Anyway, if you're thinking of booking or buying a gift for someone.....do it!

I learnt so much from the 'Get Off Auto' course. The sessions were well explained with visual examples, along with a printed guide to everything that was covered. Each week's homework challenged my skills and I will use these to continue to improve my photography. I think I am now looking at composition in a more complex way and hope to join some of the workshops in the field.
Great session on macro photography. Alan was very helpful in his explanations and advice. To be recommended.
Alan is a superb photographer. Very professional and delivers exactly what I require.  Efficient and great value with a quality result.
Really educational and practical 1-2-1 session with Alan.  Extremely worthwhile.

Brilliant!!!  Had several mentoring feedback sessions and all of them have been beneficial.  Every session full of useful and relevant information.  Assessments and feedback is honest, accurate and delivered in Alan's inimitable style.  Always something I look forward to.

I've booked a block of 4 two hour 1-1 sessions with Alan in order to gain the knowledge and experience that I need to start my journey into photography. I'm a complete novice at this, but having completed my first session, I already feel comfortable and confident that Alan will guide me through the world of photography.
Had a meeting with Alan , very supportive and honest with feedback of my work. Encouraging and good points raised in a professional manner
Very encouraging and supportive. An excellent manner that left me feeling very positive that I could improve my photography.

Had a very good mentoring session last night with Alan, plenty of work for me to do but soem very good feedback.  Feel more positive about my photography  Had another session this week in November 2021 and this was a really useful session and once again it left me feeling positive.
Fantastic tutoring. he is the master of explaining. will be using my camera to it's full potential . thanks Alan

Joined Alan on a Batsford autumn colour workshop recently which was just lovely. My first visit to Batsford which is stunning,   Alan was very professional, helping us all with set ups and composition. He had his camera to “show” but all his attention was on the group. I learnt so much and although the sun didn’t appear, I now have the tools to use in the future, thanks to Alan.

After booking the workshop with Alan Ranger for a local spot near me.  i found Alan to be very approachable and willing to help with any questions that i had.  The day i spent with Alan was great fun and i took a lot from the course to help better my hobby.  i would recommend any one of Alan's courses to any budding togger as i feel you would learn a lot no matter your skill set.
A very interesting workshop at Batsford Arboretum. Well done for completing this in very challenging weather conditions.
Really brilliant day very pleased with the images, shame about the weather.Thank you Alan
It was a breath of fresh air to be with Alan, his enthusiasm is addictive. The day definitely taught an old dog new tricks at a beautiful location, Batsford arboretum.

Autumn Photo workshop at Batsford Arboretum on Wednesday 27 October 2021.  A great day with Alan and another 3 in the group.  Very relaxed style of tuition.  Loved the panning trees technique as motorsport photography is my 1st priority!  Thank you. The Lake District events look good.  Maybe next year.  Thank you Alan, I learned so much. Even the visitors enjoyed the Redwood trees.

Batsford Arboretum Workshop  I attended the Workshop as a relative novice and by the end of it, whilst there were no competition winners, the standard of pictures I took were a huge improvement  over what I could manage before.  Alan is clearly knowledgeable, has a great eye for a picture, and provides as much or as little interaction as you require.  A very enjoyable morning
A really brilliant day at beautiful Batsford shame about the weather.
Great afternoon with Alan. I have learnt lots and I am sure that my photos have been improved as a result.

A great afternoon at Batsford Arboretum for the autumn workshop.  Alan was very helpful giving me ideas to improve my composition, assisting with my camera settings, answering any photography questions I had. A really enjoyable afternoon and look forward to going out to practice some new techniques and skills. Thanks again

I attended a one day workshop run by Alan in the Peak District. I found him very approachable and he offered up great ideas about composition and suggested using a polarising filter in situations I’d never thought of before. He was selfless in his support of all the participants and had a great sense of humour too. I thoroughly enjoyed the workshop, learned a few things (always good) and would recommend his workshops to photographers of all levels.
Excellent 'Get off Auto' class. Has given me the confidence to have a go.  Clear and easy to understand presentation and friendly manner.
I enjoyed a very informative day with Alan at Padley Gorge and Bolehill Quarry, picking up some fresh ideas that will help improve my photography. The workshop was very well organised.
Excellent morning on the macro/ abstract, Highly recommend this, I will be booking some of the other work shops. Jim
Great

From the very first session with Alan, my photography skills have improved! The lessons are well thought out with clear tuition and expert instruction; skills are built step by step in terms of both theory and practice; the pace is tailored to my individual need and the level of challenge is designed to inspire. I feel passionately about photography and excited to learn - this is fuelled by Alan’s creative approach coupled with his insightful, professional knowledge. All in all - a brilliant experience and I’m so glad Alan is guiding me on this new adventure! I can definitely recommend it!
Alan is a friendly and helpful Tutor providing easy to understand guidance - much appreciated by a beginner such as me !
Great Get off Auto course, well structured, clearly explained with good examples - feel motivated to try new skills now.

I was thrilled to find this site and organise a Zoom meeting with Alan. He understood the lightroom problem, helped me sort it out,. Didn't rush and it was so easy to follow what I had to do. Problem sorted and I can now get on and enjoy the programme. I would definitely use Alan again.
Had a great time on another woodland photo walk. As always, Alan is fully giving of his advice, knowledge and expertise and I would thoroughly recommend him to anyone.
Alan teaches with both expertise and warmth, a great combination!

I had a 2h f2f mentoring session with Alan. I thought I was pretty knowledgeable about photography however I was amazed how much I learned in that time. I feel I have been given insight into a deeper level of craft and skill and am looking forward to putting this into practice and developing it in follow up sessions

Attended a weekend workshop recently. Alan has a very balanced approach which he adapts to suit the needs and experience of his clients. Helpful, knowledgeable and attentive. Recommended to anyone wishing to improve their photographic skills.

I have participated in various workshops and training with Alan. He is very knowledgeable and does listen to your needs and acts upon them. Would recommend Alan to anyone who wants to improved their photography skills

I've only done 1 session but so far so good. The service is very professional and supportive. The feedback on my work was honest and encouraging. I'm looking forward to seeing how working with Alan develops.
Alan is very easy to work with and a good listener and teacher. I will use again.

Having completed 6 of Alan’s online courses I have learned so much. They were conducted professionally and with a personal touch. My understanding is now far greater and I cannot recommend him enough.
As a complete beginner Alan went through everything very throughly and checked our understanding definitely recommend if you too want to get off auto! Will be booking the next class for sure

Excellent zoom class. Very professional and packed with knowledge. I have learned a lot during this session, got inspired and would recommend to  anyone who wants to improve at fast pace. Thank you Alan.
Took the opportunity to outline how he could help me improve my photography and make better use of Lightroom. Alan was very helpful and I'm looking forward to my 2 hour slot in February

Alan is great to work with. Just had a really enjoyable and helpful 2 hours 1-1 coaching on Lightroom. I have lots more to learn and won't hesitate to pick this up again with Alan to help me progress to the next level. He taught me so much more than just how to use Lightroom. Thanks Alan. I'll be back soon.

Just back from an excellent 3 day workshop in Northumbria. Alan really made the most of the wild and windy conditions and chose great locations to provide opportunities to learn more about fairly advanced techniques such as long exposures, bracketing and taking more than one shot to subsequently 'mask' in photoshop. A fantastic learning experience and great fun! Thanks Alan.
I’ve enjoyed two great workshops recently. Both were very enjoyable experiences. Alan worked hard to ensure there were plenty of opportunities despite the weather being against us. Thanks Alan

I booked a one-to-one tutorial session with Alan at a local National Trust property. Alan was very personable and explained key concepts in an understandable manner. I took away one good piece of learning related to the technical side, and a number related to composition. Below are some of the pics that came from the session with Alan. I would recommend Alan.
Alan was patient, logical and unflappable.
Excellent tips and tricks, really enjoyed the session!

This worked well and was really useful. I will be signing up for more online teaching with Alan.  Ive just been on another one of these. They are really helpful and easy to fit in  'bit size' learning. Also great vale. Sign up and help Alan as well.
Always come away from one of Alan’s courses feeling invigorated and keen to practice what was taught

This is my third webinar with Alan. On each webinar he quickly assessed the knowledge of each participant so that the time was spent in what we wanted and need to learn rather than simply present a 'generic' class. He ensured that at least one image from each participant was processed during the session.  Excellent experience!
Really enjoy the lessons that I am having with Alan who is able to share his expertise with me at my level, thank you and would recommend to others.
I really love the workshops and new webseminar. I always learn a lot and they are always fun to attend.
The woodland walks that I have been on have been interesting and well worth it
I have just completed my 3rd short course with Alan i can highly recommend him for beginners
I've really enjoyed the couple of woodland walks I've been on - Alan has been generous with his snippets of advice, and there's always been a lovely bunch of people who love woodland and photography.

I had a fantastic day with Alan Ranger at Batsford. He packed so much into the day and explained some of the basic techniques very clearly, he was very  patient. I learnt loads and felt the day was well worth it and great value. I am now looking forward to a 3 day workshop in the lakes. Thank you.

I thoroughly enjoyed my time yesterday on the Bluebell Woodland workshop.  We all received Alan's individual attention as and when needed plus a few new tips and tricks. Also we were shown how to replicate his own images where other professional photographers prefer to keep that information to themselves!

I would highly recommend Alan's beginner course to anyone looking to improve not only their technical understanding and use of a camera but also their eye, aims and creation of an image. I came away feeling inspired, having grown my confidence in my camera considerably and excited to continue practising, improving and hopefully attending some of Alan's other courses in the future.

I thoroughly enjoyed the beginner's course. Alan had a good way of explaining things, supplementing these with visual representations and practical activities. The course was supported with a handbook which is very readable for a beginner's level of understanding. The group was a small group which gave time for when you wanted to ask questions and for Alan to give time to individual students. There was a lot of content which you could only fully take in by going home and reviewing / studying it. Alan has a dry sense of humour which helped make the sessions enjoyable!

Alan’s all day workshop was very enjoyable and worth every penny.Alan put you at ease and explained every thing very clearly and it was a very enjoyable and rewarding workshop and I came away with some brilliant images. I can not recommended him highly enough. He was friendly and up for a laugh all in all a Very enjoyable day.
Alan is a very good teacher - always available to comment and makes lots of suggestions and recommendations but lets you get on with your own stuff. Highly recommended

A great weekend on the 3 day Northumberland Workshop - highly recommend!  I love Alan's residential workshops - a totally rewarding experience.  The limited number of participants within the group ensures everyone benefits from Alan's excellent tuition.  See you again soon

I’ve attended a number of Alan’s workshops over the last 12 months and would thoroughly recommend them! Alan is extremely knowledgable and spends time with each person to ensure they get the maximum from the workshop. I’m looking forward to attending more workshops into the future.

Alan is inspirational photographer with great talent of being able to teach the skills needed to set you up for your own journey into photography, it dose not matter if you are complete beginner or skilled master of photographer you will benefit from his experience.

Just finished the get off manual class. Wow! So much was packed into a short session but how Alan explained things made understand each piece was excellent. Really glad I attended and wow what value for money. Highly recommend!

Alan is an amazing photographer and teacher. Im currently learning with him and don't intend on stopping any time soon. Hes understanding and encouraging of anyones ability and I just love his work and his methods of teaching. My photography has come on ten fold since learning with Alan

I have recently completed Alan's photography course for beginners and can highly recommend it to anyone who is thinking of taking up photography. He very clearly explains all the basic principles and shows you how to get the very best from your camera.  I have just enrolled on a workshop in the summer with Alan as I felt I learned so much from the first course. It's all put across in a fun and enjoyable way too. Despite having read articles on photography previously, these were no substitute for having Alan teach you in a class. He makes you think about the photographs you take and his superb landscape images inspire you to improve.I only wish I'd done the course earlier!

I have attended Alan's “Develop Your Images” course, using Adobe Lightroom, and also subscribe to his on-going Photography Mentoring.  Both have been extremely positive experiences in my photographic journey and are helping me begin to create the sort of images that a year ago were beyond my expectation and capability. He has been invaluable in helping me understand and critique images and I would happily recommend him to anyone.

An award winning photographer who knows his business down to the finest detail, he teaches photography in and around Warwickshire and the West Midlands also running workshops all over the country capturing the best that Britain has to offer. His photography classes are enjoyable giving ALL of his students due attention no matter what their skill level is and reasonably priced for a national awarded and regularly published photographer in a variety of media.

Alan's introduction course was just right for me and provided technical information but more importantly, inspiration to look for good shots: "it is photographers who take good photographs, not cameras". The instruction is delivered at a pace that matches his audience and he gives objective feedback that critical but positive. I am continuing with other courses and workshops with Alan and look forward to learning more with him about showing in my photographs what I feel about the world around me.

I attended one of Alan's courses to be able to get my camera out of Auto mode and do more with it.  I haven't looked back since and would really recommend his courses to anyone who wants to learn more.

I bought my first DSLR last May and used it on auto for sometime as I had no idea what I was doing but desperately wanted to learn so I could get the most out of the camera and my photos.  I attend Alan's beginners course and haven't looked back since!  Alan is a very easy going guy which makes it a comfortable learning experience and he was always happy to spend the time I needed to understand with me as well as answering my endless questions.  I have done two class room based courses with Alan and several location shoots and all of them have been fantastic.  The knowledge you gain from actually taking photos with Alan is priceless and he really makes you think about what you want to portray with your shot.  Alan will teach you, push you and challenge you and I will never go back to auto thanks to him!

I have done a couple of courses with Alan and a few location shots. His lessons are well laid out with excellent hand-outs for later. Alan's passion for photography comes through in his teaching. I have learnt so much about my camera and could not be happier

I attended one of Alan's introductory Photography classes for beginners and loved it.  He is inspirational and explained things really simply to make sure everyone understood. Am planning to sign up for more too.
